Detailed Description

Base Class for ForceTorqueSensors.

The ForceTorqueSensor class is a generic base class for all ATI Force Torque Sensor classes. It contains functionality to get the 3 axes force data (lbs) and the 3 axes torque data (lbs. in.) from the the ATI FTServer. The implementation for a specific ForceTorqueSensor is done in a derived class. For example, the DefaultForceTorqueSensor class.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================= 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: End Effector Classes 
// Authors:   Vijayakrishna Basettihalli
// Start Date: Fri Jun 08 06:12:46 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: ForceTorqueSensor.t.cpp
// Example program for the class ForceTorqueSensor.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <conio.h>


// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "ForceTorqueSensor.hpp"
#include "ObjectManager.hpp"

//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  
  ObjectManager om;
  ForceTorqueSensor *forceTorqueSensor = om.createDerivedObject<ForceTorqueSensor>();

  if (forceTorqueSensor->d_objectStatus.isStatusError()) 
  {
    cout << forceTorqueSensor->d_objectStatus.getMessageText() << endl;
  }
  
  cout << "Menu: " << endl;
  cout << " \t[g] Get Forces And Torques" <<endl;
  cout << " \t[q] Quit" <<endl;
  char ch;
  double ft[6]; 
  while ((ch=getch()) != 'q') 
  {
    if (ch=='g')
    {
      forceTorqueSensor->getForcesAndTorques(ft);
      cout << "Forces : " << ft[0] << "\t" << ft[1] << "\t" << ft[2] << endl;
      cout << "Torques : " << ft[3] << "\t" << ft[4] << "\t" << ft[5] << endl;
    }
  }
  
  RoboticPlatform::exit();            
  return 0;
}

void getForcesAndTorques ( double[6] ) [pure virtual]
 

Gets the 3 axes force data (Lbs) and the 3 axes Torques (Lbs- inches)from the the ATI FTServer.

Returns:
The 3 axes forces as an double array of size 3.
